He builds his whole political career so far on scapegoating and fear mongering and otherising (PH) migrants and that's very different from Barack Obama.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: But my problem with Vice President Biden and Cory pointed this out last time is every time something good about Barack Obama comes up he says oh, I was there, I was there, I was there--that's me too. And then, every time somebody questions part of the administration that we were both part of he says well, that was the president. I mean, he wants to take credit for Obama's work but not have to answer to any questions.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: --I don't get that--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: Let me just say.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: That is not what I said.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: Or a--let me just say--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: --That is not what I said--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: --That I would--I was the first candidate in early April to put forward an immigration plan. And you know why? Because I'm not afraid of Donald Trump on this issue.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: I'm not going to backpedal. I'm not going to pretend like I don't have a--my own vision for immigration. So, we're not going to give up DACA. Were not going to give up protections for anybody. I believe that on January 20th, 2021 we're going to have a Democratic president. Were going to throw out Mitch McConnell--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: --And John Cornyn and have a Democratic Senate and a Democratic House. And we're going to pass immigration reform--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: --Within the first hundred days.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: I did not say I don't stand--I stand with Barack Obama all eight years, good, bad, and indifferent. That's where I stand.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: I did not say I did not stand with him.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: Well, I start with a statement of principles, and that is in this country immigration does not make us weaker. Immigration makes us stronger.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: I want to see us expand legal immigration and create a pathway to citizenship for our Dreamers but also for their grandparents and for their cousins, for people who's overstayed student visas and for people who came here to work in the fields. I want to have a system that is a path to--to citizenship that is fair and achievable.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: Down at the border, we've got to rework this entirely. A system right now that cannot tell the difference in the threat posed by a terrorist, a criminal, and a 12-year-old girl is not a system that is keeping us safer and it is not serving our values.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: We--we need--I want to add one more part on this, because I think we have to look at all the pieces. Why do we have a crisis at the border? In no small part because we have withdrawn help from people in Central America who are suffering.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: We need to restore that help. We need to help establish and reestablish the rule of law so that people don't feel like they have to flee for their lives. We have a crisis that Donald Trump has created and hopes to profit from politically.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: We have to have the courage to stand up and fight back.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: So, yeah--oh, I'm sorry.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: My--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: --Did you ask me or--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: It was me.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: Oh, he said it. Okay. Sorry.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: My--my father grew up on a peanut farm in Asia with no floor, and now his son is running for president. That is the immigration story that we have to be able to share--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: --With the American people. If you look at our history, almost half of Fortune 500 companies were founded by either immigrants or children of immigrants, and rates of business formation are much higher in immigrant communities. We have to say to the American people immigrants are positive for our economic and social dynamism. And I would return the level of legal immigration to the point it was under the Obama/Biden administration.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: I think we have to compete for talent. And I am the opposite of Donald Trump in many ways. He says build a wall. I'm going to say to immigrants come to America because, if you come here, your son or daughter can run for president. The water is great, and this is where you want to build a company, build a family, and build a life. This country has been a magnet for human capital for generations. If we lose that, we lose something integral to our continued success. And that is where I would lead as president.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: (UNTRANSLATED)

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: Anyone who supports this is supporting racism (UNTRANSLATED).

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: The only people, though, who actually buy into this president's hateful rhetoric around immigrants are people who don't know any.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: We have an opportunity to build an American majority around immigration reform. In my community a group of conservative Republicans rallied around in individual, a beloved local individual who was deported when he went into ICE to try to get his paperwork sorted out because they never thought it would happen to him.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: In some of the most conservative rural areas of Iowa I have seen communities that embraced immigration grow and it is why part of my plan for revitalizing the economies of rural America includes community renewal visas that would allow cities and towns and counties that are hurting not only for jobs but for population to embrace immigration as we have in my city. You know the only reason that South Bend is growing right now after years of shrinking is immigration. It is one of the reasons we acted not waiting for Washington to create city issued municipal IDs so that people regardless of immigration status in our city have the opportunity to have the benefits of identification.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: We have an opportunity to actually get something done but we cannot allow this to continue to be the same debate with the same arguments in the same clever lines often among the same people since the last real reform happened in the 1980s. We have to actually engage the American majority around the opportunities for not just growth in small communities but our values, values of welcome, values of faith that all argue for us to manage this humanely and in a way that marries their values with our laws.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Beto O'Rourke
body: I do and--and if you read the rest of that article in the Washington Post I talked about harmonizing our entry/exit system with Mexico in the same way that we do with Canada. I think that could help us to keep a handle on visa overstates but I think the larger question that we are trying to get it is how do we rewrite this country's immigration laws in our own image, in the image of Houston, Texas, the most diverse city in the United States of America.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Beto O'Rourke
body: In the image of El Paso, Texas, one of the safest cities in the United States of America, safe not despite the fact that we are a city of immigrants, safe because we are a city of immigrants. (UNTRANSLATED)

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Beto O'Rourke
body: I will lead an effort to make sure that we rewrite our immigration laws in that way. Never cage another child. Make sure that there is accountability and justice for these seven lives lost under our care and our custody but also face the fact that Democrats and Republicans alike but it to build a wall that has produced thousands of deaths of people trying to cross to join family or to work a job that we have been part of the boarding people hundreds of thousands just in the Obama administration alone who pose no threat to this country, breaking up their families, Democrats have to get off the back foot. We have to lead on this issue because we know it is right. Legalize America, begin with those more than 1 million dreamers, make them U.S. right now in this their true home country--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Beto O'Rourke
body: --and extend that to their parents, their sisters and their brothers and ensure that we have a legal, safe, orderly system to come to this country and add to our greatness here.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: I will not repeal the tariffs on day one but I would let the Chinese know that we need to hammer out a deal because right now the tariffs are pummeling producers and farmers in Iowa who have absolutely nothing to do with the imbalances that we have with China.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: A CEO friend of mine was in China recently and he said that he saw pirated U.S. intellectual property on worker workstations to the tune of thousands of dollars per head. And he said one, how can my workers compete against that and two, think about all of the lost revenue to American companies. So the imbalances are real. We have to let the Chinese know that we recognize that President Trump has pursued an arbitrary and haphazard trade policy that has had victims on both sides. So no to repealing the tariffs immediately but yes to making sure that we come to a deal that addresses the concerns of American companies and American producers.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: Well, the President clearly has no strategy. You know when I first got into this race I remember President Trump scoffed and said he would like to see me making a deal with Xi Jinping. I would like to see him making a deal with Xi Jinping.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: Is it just me or was that supposed to happen in like April? It is one more example of a commitment not made. When that happens on the international stage people take note, not just our competitors, our adversaries but also our allies take note of the inability of the United States to keep its word or follow through on its plans and when that happens there are serious consequences.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: We saw it at the G7. The leaders of some of the greatest powers and economies of the world sitting to talk about one of the greatest challenges in the world, climate change, and there was literally an empty chair where American leadership couldn't have been. The problem is this is a moment when American leadership is needed more than ever whether it is in Hong Kong where those protesters were democracies need to know that they have a friend in the United States or anywhere around the world where increasingly we see dictators throwing their weight around. The world needs America but it can't be just any America it has to--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: I would have a strategy that would include the tariffs as leverage but it's not about the tariffs. Look, what is going on right now is the President who has reduce the entire China challenge into a question of tariffs when what we know is that the tariffs are coming down on us more than anybody else and there is a lack of a bigger strategy.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: What we've got right now though, George, it is not a focused tariffs on steel. What he has done here he has assessed these tariffs on our allies, he has put us in the middle of this trade war and he is treating our farmers and our workers like poker chips and one of his bankrupt casinos and if we are not careful he is going to bankrupt this country.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: One forecast recently says that it is already cost us 300,000 jobs. All right? There is soybeans that are mounting up in bins all over the Midwest, in my state of Minnesota and in Iowa. So when I think we need to do is to go back to the negotiating table. That is what I would do. I wouldn't have put all of these tariffs in place and I wouldn't have had a trade policy where on August 1 he announces he is going to have tariffs on $300 billion of goods, on August 13 he cuts it in half, a week later he says he's going to reduce taxes, the day after that he says he is going to do it.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: The leaders of the world are watching this and it undermines our strength as a nation and yes, we want fair trade but we must work with the rest of the world and he has made a mockery of focused trade policy which I think means enforcement like we have done in northern Minnesota passing bills, getting President Obama to do more on that so that our workers can benefit so we are importing--exporting goods and making sure that it is a competitive policy where our goal is that we are making things, inventing things, and exporting to the world. He is defeating that goal.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: Well, look, I agree with those who have said that this erratic, haphazard trade war is hurting American families. As Senator Klobuchar said, 300,000 American jobs, it's estimated that it's cost $600 to the average American family. Just a couple of days ago, 60 percent of Americans said that they believe that we are in for a recession next year. So when I become president, I would immediately begin to negotiate with China to ratchet down that trade war. We have leverage there. I also believe though that we need to return to a leader when it comes to things like human rights. We have millions of Uighurs, for instance, in China that right now are being imprisoned and mistreated.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: And in North Korea, this president is elevating a dictator. We need to stop that. We need to return to ensuring that America leads again on human rights. When it comes to this trade war, I would immediately begin ratcheting that trade war down. We have leverage in that discussion.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: So our trade policy in America has been broken for decades. And it has been broken because it works for giant national corporations and not for much of anyone else. These are giant corporations that, shoot, if they can save a nickel by moving a job to a foreign country, they'll do it in a heartbeat. And yet, for decades now, who's been whispering in the ears of our trade negotiators? Who has shaped our trade policy? It's been the giant corporations. It's been their lobbies lobbyists and their executives. The way we change our trade policy in America is, first, the procedures, who sits at the table. I want to negotiate trade with unions at the table. I want to negotiate it with small farmers at the table.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: I want to negotiate it with environmentalists at the table. I want to negotiate with human rights activists at the table. And you asked the question about leverage. If I could just respond to that one, leverage, are you kidding? Everybody wants access to the American market. That means that we have the capacity to say right here in America you want to come so goods to American consumers? Then you've got to raise your standards. You've got to raise your labor standards. You've got to raise your environmental standards. So our companies can compete on a level playing field.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: We can use trade not to undermine American workers and not to undermine American farms and not to undermine small businesses in this country. We can use trade to help build a stronger economy.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: Well, first of all, I--I have no criticism of that more than just looking at where we are now, which is that we've got a guy in the White House who has been erratic on trade policy. He conducts trade policy by tweet, frankly, born out of his fragile ego. It has resulted in farmers in Iowa with soybeans rotting in bins looking at bankruptcy. When we look at this issue, my trade policy under a Harris administration American products is always going to be about saying we need to export, not American jobs. And to do that, we have to have a meaningful trade policy.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: I am not a protectionist Democrat. Look, we need to sell our stuff, and that means you need to sell it to people overseas. That means we need trade policies that allow that to happen. You asked earlier about China. It's a complicated relationship. We have to hold China accountable. They steal our products, including our intellectual property, the dump substandard products into our economy. They need to be held accountable.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: We also need to partner with China on climate and the crisis that that presents. We need to partner with China on the issue of North Korea. I am on, and I think the only person on the stage, the Senate intelligence entity and the Senate Homeland security committee. We need a partner on the issue of North Korea. But the bottom line is this. Donald Trump in office on trade policy, you know, he reminds me of that--that guy in the Wizard of Oz, you know, when you pull back the curtain, it's a really small dude.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: (INAUDIBLE)

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: There is a reason--there is a reason why in the last 45 years the average American today, despite an explosion of technology and worker productivity has stopped making a penny more than he or she made 45 years ago. And one of the reasons is that for decades, we have had disastrous trade policies.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: I've got to say to my good friend Joe Biden, Joe and I strongly disagree on trade. I helped lead the opposition to NAFTA and PNTR, which cost this country over 4 million good paying jobs.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: And what happened is people who had those jobs ended up getting other jobs making 50 percent of what they made in manufacturing.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: So, Trump obviously hasn't a clue. Trump thinks that trade policy is a tweet at 3:00 in the morning. What we have got to do is develop a trade policy that represents workers, represents the farmers in the Midwest and elsewhere who are losing billions right now because of Trump's policy, a trade policy which understands that if a company shuts down in America and goes abroad and then thinks that they're going to get online to get a lucrative federal contract, under Bernie Sanders--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: --They got another guess coming.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: Yeah. Well, look, we are either going to make policy or China's going to make the trade--the rules of the road. We make up 25 percent of the world economy. We need another 25 percent to join us. And I think Eliza--Senator Warren is correct. At the table has to be labor and at the table has to be environmentalists.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: The fact of the matter is China--the problem is in the trade deficit. The problem is they are stealing our intellectual property. The problem is they're violating the WTO. They're dumping steel on us. That's a different issue than whether or not there dumping agricultural products on us.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: In addition to that, we're in a position where, if we don't set the rules, we in fact are going to find ourselves with China setting the rules. And that's why you need to organize the world to take on China to stop the corrupt practices that are underway.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: Sure. There's a one point we're really missing on the stage right now, which is the fact that Donald Trump's America First policy is actually and America isolated, and America alone policy.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: Exactly right.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: From trade to--to battling China to the climate--global crisis of climate change, the challenges in the Middle East, he is pulling us away from our allies; out of the Iran deal, out of the Paris Climate Accords. And on trade, he's deciding to take on China while at the same time taking on tariff battles with all of our allies.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: You literally have him using a national security waiver to put tariffs on Canada. Now, look, I'm the only person on this stage that finds Trudeau's hair very menacing.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: But they are not a national security threat. We cannot go up against China alone. This is a president that has a better relationship with the dictators like Duarte and Putin than he does with Merkel and Macron. We are the strongest nation on the planet Earth--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: --And our strength is multiplied and magnified when we stand with our allies in common cause and common purpose. That's how we be China. That's how we be climate change on the planet Earth. And that's how American values are the ones that lead on issues of trade and workers rights.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: Yes. And I'll tell you why. What we're doing right now in Afghanistan is not helping the safety and security of the United States. It is not helping the safety and security of the world. It is not helping the safety and security of Afghanistan. We need to bring our troops home.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: And then we need to make a big shift. We cannot ask our military to keep solving problems that cannot be solved militarily.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: We're not going to bomb our way to a solution in Afghanistan. We need to treat the problem of terrorism is a worldwide problem, and that means we need to be working with all of our allies, our European allies, our Canadian allies, our Asian allies, our allies in Africa and in South America. We need to work together to root out terrorism.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: It means using all of our tools. It means economic investment. It means expanding our diplomatic efforts instead of hollowing out the State Department and deliberately making it so we have no eyes and tears in many of these countries. We need a foreign policy.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: That is about our security and about leading on our values.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: I was in Afghanistan with John McCain two years ago this past summer--I think it may have been Senator McCain's last trip before he was sick. And, I talked to people--we did--we talked to military leaders American and local leaders. We talked to people on the ground and asked the questions same one I ask on the Senate Armed Services Committee, every time one of the generals comes through--show me what winning looks like--tell me what it looks like. And what you hear is a lot of (INAUDIBLE). Because no one can describe it.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: And, the reason no one can describe it is because the problems in Afghanistan are not problems that can be solved by a military. I have three older brothers who have served in the military--I understand firsthand the kind of commitment they have made. They will do anything we ask them to do, but we cannot ask them to solve problems that they alone cannot solve. We need to work with the rest of the world. We need to use our economic tools. We need to use our diplomatic tools. We need to build with our allies and we need to make the whole world safer not keep troops bombing in Afghanistan.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: You know, I served under General Dunford way under General Dunford, in Afghanistan.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: And, today, September 12th, 2019 means that today you could be 18 years old--old enough to serve and have not been alive on 9/11. We have got to put an end to endless war. And the way we do it is see to it that that country will never again be used for an attack against our homeland and that does not require an open ended commitment of ground troops.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: Let me say something else because if there's one thing we've learned about Afghanistan--from Afghanistan it's that the best way not to be caught up in endless war is to avoid starting one in the first place.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: And so, when I am president an authorization for a use of military force will have a built in three year sunset. Congress will be required to vote and a president will be required to go to congress to seek an authorization. Because if our troops can summon the courage to go overseas the least our members of congress should be able to do is summon the courage to take a vote on whether they ought to be there. By the way, we also have a president right now who seems to treat troops as props or worse--tools for his own enrichment.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: We saw what's going on with flights apparently being routed through Scotland just so people can stay at his hotels. I'll tell you--as a military officer the very first thing that goes through your mind, the first time you ever make eye contact with somebody that you are responsible for in uniform--is do not let these men and women down. This president is doing exactly that. I will not.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: No, it was (INAUDIBLE) wrong to pull out. I want to answer the Afghanistan question. I've been in and out of Afghanistan--not with a gun. And I admire my friend for his service. But I've been in and out of Afghanistan more than anybody on this--on this--and it's an open secret you reported a long time ago, George, that I was opposed to the surge in Afghanistan. The whole purpose of going to Afghanistan was to not have a counter insurgency meaning that we're going to put that country together. It cannot be put together. Let me--let me say it again--it will not be put together.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: It's three different countries--Pakistan owns the three counties the--the three provinces in the east. They are not any part of it. The economy is running--I can go on and on but here's the point--the point is that it's a counter terrorism strategy. We can prevent the United States from being the victim of terror coming out of Afghanistan by providing for bases and insist that Pakistanis provide bases for us to air--airlift from and to move against what we know. We don't need those troops there. I would bring them home. And Joe Dunford is a fine guy but this has been an internal argument we've had for eight years.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: With regard to--with regard to Iraq--the fact of the matter is you know, I should have never voted to give Bush the authority to go in and do what he said he was going to do. The AUMF was designed, he said, to go in and get the security council to vote 15 to nothing to allow inspectors to go in and determine whether or not anything was being done with chemical weapons or nuclear weapons.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: and when that happened he went ahead and went anyway without any of that proof. I said something that was not meant the way I said it. I said from that point on. What I was argued against in the beginning fronts once he started to put the troops in was that in fact we were doing it the wrong way, there was no plan. We should not be engaged. We didn't have the people with us. We didn't have our alliance, we didn't have allies with us, etc. And it was later when we came into office that Iraq turned--the President turned to me and said Joe, when they said we've got a plan to get out he turned to the whole security said simply Joe will organize this, get the troops home. My son spent a year in Iraq and I understand it--and we were right to get the combat troops out.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: The big mistake that was made which we predicted was that they would not have a circumstance where the Shia and the Kurds would work together to keep ISIS from coming--from moving in. (INAUDIBLE)

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: David, let me answer that but let me just comment on something that the vice president said. You talked about the big mistake in Iraq and the surge. The truth is the big mistake, the huge mistake in one of the big differences between you and me I never believed what Cheney and Bush said about Iraq.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: You are right.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: I voted against the war in Iraq and help lead the opposition and it's sad to say. I mean I kind of had the feeling that there would be massive destabilization in that area if we went into that war. As the former Chairman of the Senate committee on Veterans Affairs I want to pick up on what Pete said. We cannot express our gratitude to all of the men and women who have put their lives on the line to defend--defend us, who have responded to the call of duty. But I think also I am the only person up here to have voted against all three of trumps military budgets.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: I don't think we have to spend $750 billion a year on the military when we don't even know who our enemy is.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: I think that what we have got to do is bring this world together, bring it together on climate change, bring it together in fighting against terrorism and make it clear that we as a planet, as a global community, will work together to help countries around the world rebuild their struggling economies and do everything that we can to rid the world of terrorism by dropping bombs on Afghanistan and Iraq was not the way to do it.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: I signed a pledge to in the forever wars. We have been in a state of continuous armed conflict for 18 years which is not what the American people want.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: We have to start owning what we can and can't do. We are not very good at rebuilding countries and if you want proof all you have to do is look within our own country at Puerto Rico. We have spent trillions of dollars to unclear benefits, lost thousands of lives and thank you Pete for your service and the goal has to be to rebuild the relationships that have made America strong for decades. I would lead our Armed Forces with the restraint and judgment. With the American people one is simply a President who has the right values and point of view and they can trust to make the right decisions when it comes to putting our young men and women into harm's way and that is what I would do as President

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: Well, first of all let me be very clear anybody who does what Maduro does is a vicious tyrant. What we need now is international and regional cooperation for free elections in Venezuela so that the people of that country can make and can create their own future.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: In terms of democratic socialism to equate what goes on in Venezuela with what I believe is extremely unfair.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: --Tell you what I believe in terms of democratic socialism. I agree with what goes on in Canada and in Scandinavia, guaranteeing healthcare to all people as a human right.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: I believe that the United States should not be the only major country on earth not to provide paid family and medical leave.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: I believe that every worker in this country deserves a living wage and that we expand the trade union movement.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: I happen to believe also that what, to me, democratic socialism means is we deal with an issue, we do not discuss in a foyer, not in the media, and not in Congress. You've got three people in America owning more wealth than the bottom half of this country. You've got a handful of billionaires controlling what goes on in Wall Street, the insurance companies, and in the media. Maybe, just me and maybe, what we should be doing is creating an economy that works for all of us, not 1 percent. That's my understanding of democratic socialism.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: Sure. Thank you, Jorge. I'll call Maduro a dictator because he is a dictator.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: And while we need to do is to, along with our allies, make sure that the Venezuelan people get the assistance that they need, that we continue to pressure Venezuela so that they'll have free and fair elections, and also here in the United States, offer temporary protected status, TPS to Venezuelans.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: That is something that the Trump administration has failed to do. For all have his big talk about supporting the Venezuelan American community, he has failed. I will not. I also believe that we need to do things like a 21st century Marshall plan for Honduras, El Salvador, and Guatemala so that people can find safety--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: And opportunity at home instead of having to make the dangerous journey to the United States. And, under my administration, we're going to put renewed focus on Latin America. It makes sense. They are our neighbors and we have a lot of things in common. It also makes sense that--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: --That because we have a country like China that is going around the world to places like Africa and Latin America making their own relationships, strengthening those, United States needs to strengthen its partnerships in Latin America immediately. And I will.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: You know, first of all, I want to say no. Actually, I want to translate that into Spanish. No.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: Look, on--let's just be clear, the factory farming going on that's assaulting this corporate consolidation, the agriculture industry, one of the reasons why I have a bill to put a moratorium on this kind of corporate consolidation is because this factory farming is destroying and hurting our environment. You see independent family farmers being pushed out a business because of the kind of incentives we are giving that don't line up with our values. That's what I'm calling for.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: But I want to--I want to switch because we don't have a crowded debate stage, we were talking about Afghanistan and Iraq, it--it annoys me that we have a conversation about our troops overseas and we didn't say one word about veterans in our country.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: We have a shameful reality in America that we send people off to war and they often come home with invisible wounds, hurts, and harms. They are disproportionately homeless. You hear stories about women waiting for months or gynecological care through the VA. It is very important that as we as a country understand that we are not going to solve every problem with this outrageous increased militarism that we also make sure that we stand up for the people that stood for us. We end our national anthem home of the brave. It's about time we make this a better home for our bravest.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Beto O'Rourke
body: Yes, we will follow through regardless of the political consequences or who it offends because this is the very future of our planet and our ability for our children and grandchildren to be able to survive on it. We will make sure that we get to net zero greenhouse gas emissions no later than the year 2050, that we are halfway there by 2030, that we mobilize $5 trillion over the next 10 years to do that, that we invest here in Houston, Texas with pre-disaster mitigation grants to protect those communities that are vulnerable to flooding. Given the fact that this town has seen three 500 year floods--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Beto O'Rourke
body: In just five years, you'd like to think you're good for 1500 years, but you're not. They're coming faster and larger and more devastating than ever. We are also going to make sure that we free ourselves from dependence on fossil fuels and embrace renewable wind and solar energy technology, as well as the high-paying, high skill, high wage jobs that come along with that. And then we're going to pay farmers for the environmental services that they want to provide.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Beto O'Rourke
body: Cover crops, keeping more land under conservation. Using no till farming, regenerative agriculture can pull carbon out of the air and can drive it and sequester it into the soil. That's the way that were going to meet this challenge and we're going to bring everyone into the solution.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: Thank you. This is the existential crisis of our time. It's--you know that movie the Day After Tomorrow? It's today. We have seen a warming in our world like never before. We are seeing flooding in the Midwest, flooding in Houston fires in the West.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: And I think having someone leading the ticket from the Midwest will allow us to talk about this in a different way and get it done. On day one, I will get us back into the International Climate Change Agreement.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: On day two, I will bring back the clean power rules that President Obama had worked on. And on day three, I will bring back the gas mileage standards. You can do all that without Congress, which is good. On day four, five, and six, I will, working with Congress and mayors and businesspeople all over the country, introduced sweeping legislation to get at that 2050--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: --Goal. And on day seven you're supposed to rest, but I won't.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Amy Klobuchar
body: This is what we need to do if we're going to get at climate change. We have to take this on as a crisis that's happening right now.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: Yes. We need to work on every front on climate change. It is the threat to every living thing on this planet and we are running out of time. Every time the scientists go back, they say we have less and less time than we thought we had. But that means we got to use all the tools.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: One of the tools we need to use are our regulatory tools. I have proposed, following Governor Inslee, that we by 2028 cut all carbon emissions from new buildings, by 2030 carbon emissions from cars, and by 2035 all carbon emissions from the manufacture of electricity. That alone, those three, will cut our emissions here in the United States by 70 percent. We can do this.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: We also need to help around the world to clean, but understand this one more time. Why doesn't it happen?

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: As long as Washington is paying more attention to money than it is to our future, we can make the changes we need to make. We have to attack corruption head on so that we can save our planet.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: When I think about this issue, it really is through the lens of my baby nieces, who are one and a half and three years old. When I look at what is going to be the world if we do nothing when they turn 20, I am really scared. And when I've been in the United States Senate for now the last two and half years and I look at our counterparts, the Republicans in the United States Senate, they must be looking at their children. And then when they look at the mirror, I don't know what they see, but it's a lack of courage.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: And these--this is an issue that, yes, it represents an existential threat. It is also something we can do something about. And this is a problem that was created by human behaviors, and we can change our behaviors in a way that saves our planet. I've seen it happen.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: In California, I took on--as the Attorney General of California, I ran the second largest Department of Justice in the United States, second only to the United States Department of Justice. I took on the big oil companies and we saw progress. If any of you have been to Los Angeles--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: --Twenty years ago, you'll remember that sky was brown. You go there now, the sky is blue. And you know why? Because leaders decided to lead, and we took on these big fossil fuel companies. We have some of the most important and strongest laws--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: --In the country, and we made a difference. And my point being I've done it before and I will lead as president on this issue because we have no time. The clock is tipping--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: --Ticking, but--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: --We need courage and we need courageous leadership. We can get this done.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: So to follow up on what Elizabeth said, why are we losing to the fossil fuel companies--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: --Yeah--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: --Why are we losing to the gun lobby and the NRA? And the answer is this. We all know, everyone on this stage knows, that our government has been overrun by money and corporate interests. Now, everyone here has a plan to try and curb those corporate interests, but we have to face facts.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: Money finds a way. The money will find its way back in. So, what is the answer? The answer is to wash the money out with a people powered money.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: My proposal is that we give every American 100 democracy dollars that you can only give to candidates and causes that you like. This would wash out the lobbyist cash by a factor of eight to one. That is the only way we will win. And as someone running for president, I'll tell you there is the people on one side and the money on the other. The only way for us to win is if we bring them together.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: Let me be clear, I am pro-good school. I've got a kid one of my little boys just started public school last weekend I was not there because I was running for president.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: So we need to pay teachers more because the data clearly shows that a good teacher is worth his or her weight in gold.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: We need to lighten up the emphasis on standardized test which do not measure anything fundamental about our character or human worth.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: But here is the big one, the data clearly shows that 65 percent to 70 percent of our students outcomes are determined outside of the school. We are talking about time spent at home with the parents, words read to them when they are young, stress levels in the house, income, type of neighborhood. We are putting money into schools and educators know this, we are saying you are 100 percent responsible for educating our kids but you can only control 30 percent. They all know this, the answer is to put money directly into the families and neighborhoods to give our kids a chance to learn and our teachers the chance to teach.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: Step one is a point a Secretary of Education new actually believes in public education.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: I believe in public education and in order to strengthen it some things are very complex for preparing for a future where knowledge is that at your fingertips but we have got to teach more to do with critical thinking and social and emotional learning. Some of it is extremely simple, we have just got to pay teachers more. And we have got to lift up the teaching profession.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: I always think of a story from South Bend of friends who host exchange students from Japan. They had a student one year who wanted to be a teacher and they kept in touch with her when she went back to Japan and to college. She took the exam to try to become a teacher in a society that really regards teachers and compensates teachers well and she came up just short. So you know what she did since she was academically good but couldn't quite make the cut to be a teacher? She had a fallback--fallback plan, she became a doctor. That is how seriously some countries treat the teaching profession.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: If we want to get the results that we expect for our children we have to support and compensate the teaching profession respected teachers the way we do soldiers and pay them more like the way we do doctors.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: You know, I think I'm the only person on this stage who has been a public school teacher.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: I wanted to be a public school teacher since I was in second grade. And let's be clear in all of the ways we talk about this money for public schools should stay in public schools not go anywhere else.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: I have already made my commitment. I will--we will have a Secretary of Education who has been a public school teacher.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: I think this is ultimately about our values. I have proposed a two cent wealth tax on the top 1/10 of 1 percent in this country. That would give us enough money to start with our babies by providing universal childcare for every baby age 0 to 5, universal pre-K for every three-year-old and four-year-old in this country--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: --raise the wages of every childcare worker and preschool teacher in this country, cancel student loan debt for 95 percent of the folks who have got it--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: And strengthen our unions. This is how we build an America that reflects our values not just where the money comes from with the billionaires and corporate executives.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: My first grade teacher Mrs. Francis Wilson, God rest her soul attended my law school graduation. I think most of us would say that we are not where we are without the teachers who believed in us. I have offered in this campaign a proposal to deal with this which will be the first in the nation federal investment in closing the teacher pay gap which is $13,500 a year because right now in our public schools are teachers 94 percent of them are coming out of their own pocket to help pay for school supplies.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: And that is wrong. I also want to talk about where we are here at TS you and what it means in terms of HBCUs. I have as part of my proposal that we will put $2 trillion into investing in our HBCUs for teachers--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: --because--because--because one, as a proud graduate of a historically black college and university--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: -- I will say--I will say that it is our HBCUs that disproportionately produce teachers and those who serve in these many professions but also--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: But this is a critical point

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: If a black child has a black teacher before the end of third grade they are 13 percent more likely to go to college.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: If that child has had two black teachers before the end of third grade they are 32 percent more likely to go to college. So, when we talk about investing in our public education system it is at the source of so much when we fix it that will fix so many other things. We must invest in the (INAUDIBLE).

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: And I strongly believe you can judge a society based on how it treats its children and we are (INAUDIBLE) on this issue.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: Guess what?

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: You're guessing, all right--now, here's the answer--we are the wealthiest country in the history of the world and yet we have the highest child poverty rate of almost any country on earth. We have teachers in this country who are leaving education because they can't work two or three jobs to support themselves.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: That's right.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: Which is why under my legislation we will move to see that every teacher in America makes at least $60,000 a year.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: What we will also do is not only have universal pre-K we will make public colleges and universities and HBCUs debt free.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: And what we will also do because this is an incredible burden on millions and millions of young people who did nothing wrong except try to get the education they need--we are going to cancel all student debt in this country.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: We are going to do that by imposing a tax on Wall Street speculation.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: Well, they have to deal with the--look--there is institutional segregation in this country. And from the time I got involved I started dealing with that--redlining, banks, making sure that we are in a position where look--you talk about education. I propose that what we take is those very poor schools the Title 1 schools--triple the amount of money we spend from 15 to 45 billion a year. Give every single teacher a raise an equal raise of getting out the $60,000 level.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: Number two, make sure we bring in the help (INAUDIBLE) the teachers deal with the problems that come from home. The problems that come from home we need--we have one school psychologist for every 1500 kids in America today. It's crazy. The teachers are (INAUDIBLE) I'm married to a teacher. My deceased wife is a teacher. They have every problem coming to them. We have to make sure that every single child does, in fact, have three, four and five year olds go to school. School. Not daycare. School. We bring social workers into homes of parents to help them deal with how to raise their children.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: It's not that they don't want help. They don't know quite what to do. Play the radio. Make sure the television--excuse me, make sure you have the record player on at night the--the phone. Make sure the kids hear words. A kid coming from a very poor school--a very poor background will hear 4 million words fewer spoken by the time they get there. There is so much we can--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: No, I'm going to go like the rest of them do--twice over. Ok?

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: Because here's the deal--the deal is that we've got this little backwards. And by the way, in Venezuela we should be allowing people to come here form Venezuela. I know Maduro, I've confronted Maduro. Number two, you talk about the need to do something in Latin America--I'm the guy that came up with $740 million to see to it those three countries in fact, change their system so people don't have a chance. You all are acting like we just discovered this yesterday.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: Thank you very much--well that's--that's quite a lot. But--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: You know, I grew up in one of those neighborhoods that folks have talked about in a neighborhood that was grappling with the legacy of segregation. In fact, in two public school districts that were involved in a 1973 Supreme Court case challenging how Texas financed its schools. And, I know that today, our schools are segregated because our neighborhoods are segregated.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: Right.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: Now, I have an education plan like a lot of folks up here that would pay teachers more, that would recruit diverse ranks of teachers, that would invest in our public schools. But I also believe that we have to connect the dots to uplift the quality of life--to invest in housing opportunity, to invest in job opportunity, to invest in community schools that offer resources like parents able to go back and get their GED and healthcare opportunities. And those things that truly, truly ensure that the entire family can prosper.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: Those are the types of things that we need to do in addition to lifting up our public schools. You asked a second ago about charter schools. Look, it is a myth that charter schools are better than public schools. They're not.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: And so--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Julian Castro
body: --While I'm not categorically against charter schools, I would require more transparency and accountability from them that is required right now.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: So, I'm--I'm hearing a lot of conversations on the stage that--and the way we talk about communities of color. Look, I--I live in a black and brown community below the poverty line. I lived in public housing projects almost for a decade and saw the anguish of the parents who are just so deeply frustrated that they don't have a school that serves their genius.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: I think I'm the only person on the stage, even though I had no formal authority as mayor to run a school system, I stepped up and took responsibility for our schools and we produced results. A lot of folks here talking about raising teacher's salary. We actually did it in Newark, New Jersey.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: And we didn't stop there. Yeah, we closed for performing charter schools but, dagnabbit, we expanded high-performing charter schools. We were a city that said we need to find local solutions that worked for our community. The results speak for themselves. We are now the number one city in America for a beat the odds of the schools, from high poverty to high-performance.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: Strategies like investing in our children work. And I'll tell you this. I--I am tired of us thinking about these problems isolated, disconnected from other issues. That's why my friend, Secretary Castro, is 100 percent right. We are in the reality we are right now because, vice president, of overtly racist policies not 400 years ago, just in my lifetime, that we are redlining communities, dis-investing in communities. And more than just that, my kids are not only struggling with racial segregation in housing and--and the challenges of underfunded schools, but they're also struggling with environmental injustice.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: If you talk to someone who's a parent of a child who's had permanent brain damage because of lead, you'll know this is a national problem, because there's over 3,000 jurisdictions in America where children have more than twice the blood lead levels of Flint, Michigan.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: And so, if I'm president of the United States, it is a holistic solution to education from raising teacher's salary, fully funded special education, but combating the issues of poverty, combating the issues of racial segregation, combating the issues of a criminal justice system--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: --That takes parents away from their kids, and dealing with environmental justice as a major pillar of any climate policy.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: I--I never count any professional setback I have as a serious setback. There's things that are important, things that are unimportant.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: --I'm sorry.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: There's setbacks and there's setbacks. And I think the most critical setback that can occur to anyone is to lose--well, my dad had an expression. He said Joe, it's not a question of succeeding whether you get knocked down, it's how quickly you get up. And--and he he'd say--he'd you never explain and never complain. And then he'd go on to say that the only obligation that really matters, the most important thing is family. It's why I was raised to believe that that was the center of everything, family. And you could be judged on how you treat your family and how you went from there.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: And I--it took--you know, Kierkegaard said faith sees best in the dark. Right after I got elected, my wife and daughter were killed in an automatic automobile accident and my--and my two sons were badly injured and I'd just been elected, not sworn in. And I lost my faith for a while. I came back. And then later, when my send son Bo (SP) came from home from Iraq and with a terminal disease and a year later--a year and half later losing him was like losing part of my soul. But the fact is that I learned that the way you deal with it is you deal with finding purpose. Purpose and what you do.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Joe Biden
body: And that's why I hope--I hope he's proud of me today because he wanted to make sure I'd didn't run for president but I stayed engaged because when you get hit badly, whether you're losing a job or you're raising a family my dad where you have to make that longest walk up the stairs to tell your kid you can't live here anymore, dad lost his job, you know, we--we've all been through that in some form or another. But it just takes--it just, for me, the way I've dealt with it is finding purpose. And my purpose is to do what I've always tried to do and stay engaged in public policy and--but there's a lot of people who been through a lot worse than I have, get up every single morning, put their feet one foot in front of another without the help I had. They are real heroes out there. Real heroes.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: I'm mentioned earlier I've known what I wanted to be since second grade. I wanted to be a public school teacher. And I invested early. I used to line my dollies up and teach school. I had a reputation for being tough but fair.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: By the time I graduated from high school, my family didn't have money for to send me off to four years at the University. And my story, like a lot of stories, has a lot of twists and turns. I got a scholarship college application, much less and then, at 19, got married, dropped out of school, took a minimum wage job, thought my dream was over. I got a chance down the road at the University of Houston and I made it as a special needs teacher. I still remember that first year as a special needs teacher. I could tell you what those babies look like. I had four--I had four to six-year-olds.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: But at the end of that first year, I was visibly pregnant. And back of the day, that meant that the principal said to me--wished me luck and hired someone else for the job. So there I am. I'm at home, I've got a baby, I can't have a job. What am I going to do? Here's resilience. I said I'll go to law school. And the consequence was I practice law for about 45 minutes and then went back to my first love, which is teaching. But let me get into fights, it gave me new tools. And the reason I'm standing here today is because I got back up, I fought back. I know what's broken. I want to be in the fight to fix it in America. That's--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Elizabeth Warren
body: Why I am here.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: Resilience to me means growing up in a rent-controlled apartment in Brooklyn, New York, the son of an immigrant who came to this country without a nickel in his pocket. Professional resilience means to me, George, running for U.S. Senate in Vermont and getting 1 percent of the vote, running for governor and getting 2 percent of the vote, finally becoming mayor of Burlington, Vermont, with 10 vote margin. What resilience means to me is that throughout my political career I have taken on virtually every powerful special interest in this country. Whether it is Wall Street--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Bernie Sanders
body: --whether it is the insurance industry, whether it is the pharmaceutical industry whose corruption and greed is killing people today, whether it is a military industrial complex or a prison industrial complex. And I feel confident that given a lifelong record of taking on powerful special interest, of standing up for the working families of this country that I will be able to take on the greed and corruption of the corporate elite and create a government and an economy that work for all of us not just the 1 percent.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: You know, every office I have run for whether it be district attorney or attorney general I was told each time it can be done. They said nobody like you has done it before, you are--nobody is ready for you. When I ran for DA I want and became the first black woman elected DA in a state of 40 million people in San Francisco. When I ran for Atty. Gen. of California I was elected because I didn't listen and I was the only black elected woman black elected attorney general in the state--in the country. And each time people would say it's not your time, it's not your turn, it's going to be too difficult, they are not ready for you and I didn't listen and a part of it probably comes from the fact that I was raised by a mother who said many things that were life lessons for me including don't you ever let anybody tell you who you are, you tell them who you are.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Kamala Harris
body: And when I look around the town halls that we do in this race for President of the United States and I look at the--the meetings that we do and the community meetings and I see these little girls and boys sometimes even brought by their fathers and they bring them to me and I talk to them during these events and they smile and they are full of joy and their fathers tell them see don't you ever listen and let anybody ever tell you what you can or cannot be you have to believe what can be unburdened by what has been.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: You know as a military officer serving under don't ask don't tell and as an elected official in the state of Indiana when Mike Pence was governor at a certain point when it came to professionals setbacks I had to wonder whether just acknowledging who I was was going to be the ultimate career ending professional setback.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: I came back from the deployment and realize that you only get to live one life and I was not interested in not knowing what it was like to be in love any longer so I just came out. I had no idea what kind of professional setback it would be especially because inconveniently it was an election year in my socially conservative community. What happened was when I trusted voters to judge me based on the job that I did for them they decided to trust me and reelected me with 80 percent of the vote and what I learned was that trust can be reciprocated and that part of how you can win and deserve to win is to know what is worth more to you than winning. And I think that is what we need in the presidency right now. We have to know what we are about in this election is not about any of us up here, it is not about this president even though it is hard to talk of anything else some days. It is about the people who trust us with their lives. The kid wondering if we are actually going to make their schools safe when they have learned active shooter drills before they have learned to read; a generation wondering whether we will actually get the job done on climate change

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Pete Buttigieg
body: XXX on climate change

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: I was an unhappy lawyer for five full months and I left to start a business. And I'm going to share with you all one of the secrets entrepreneurship. If you want to start something, tell everyone you know you're going to do it, and then you don't have a choice. You put your heart and soul into it.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: And even though I did that, my company flopped, had it's a mini rise and maximum fall. I lost investors, hundreds of thousands of dollars, still owed 100,000 in school debt. My parents still told people I was a lawyer. I guess it was a little easier.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: So, I remember lying--lying on my floor looking up, wondering how it had come to this. Eventually, I picked myself back up. I kept working in small growth companies for another 10 years, and eventually had some success.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: Then after I did have some success, I still remember how hard it was, how isolating it was, how it feels like your friends no longer want to spend time with you. And so, I spent seven years starting and running a nonprofit that help train young entrepreneurs around the country, including Sean Nguyen (PH), who's here in the audience tonight, who left--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: --Who left his gilded Wall Street job to be--to become a food entrepreneur in San Antonio. Sean, I hope I made the process a little bit easier for you than it was for me.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Andrew Yang
body: But the goal of my campaign is to make this an economy that allows us to live our human values and aspirations.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: so, I--my biggest professional setback is--is embarrassing because a lot of folks know about it. I, with a bunch of tenant leaders in Newark, New Jersey in 2002 took on the political machine. And boy, did they fight back. I had tires on my car slashed. Our campaign offices were broken into. My phones were tapped. It became a spectacle and we lost that election.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: And here's a bit of advice to everybody. If you're going to have a spectacular failure, have a documentary team there to capture it, because it made for--

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: --An Oscar-nominated documentary called Street Fight. But then, unfortunately, another setback. It lost in the Oscars to a movie called March of the dagnabbed Penguins, for crying out loud.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: The people in my community, was living in the projects, told me don't give up on the people and the people won't give up on you. Create bigger and bolder coalitions and you're going to win. And you know what? We came back four years later and one of the largest lopsided victory in our city's history. But more than that, the lesson was there.

title: ABC HOSTS 2019 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATES DEBATES IN HOUSTON
name: Cory Booker
body: We didn't give up. We were taking on America's toughest problems from crime to poverty, and we transformed our city, creating tens of thousands of new jobs, the biggest economic expansion in our city, and as I said before, turned around our school system.
